question: The Cripps Mission was welcomed and accepted by which among the following ?
explanation: The Cripps mission came to India in March 1942. The mission was headed by a Sir Stafford Cripps. The mission was sent to negotiate an agreement with the nationalist Congress leaders. The mission asked India to keep loyalty to the British war effort and promised of elections and full self-government or Dominion status after the cessation of the World War II. Muslim League did not accept the Cripps proposal as there was no proposal for separate Pakistan. The Sikhs, Hindu Mahasabha, Anglo Indian, Christian and the depressed section also rejected the proposal as there were no safeguard for them.
